thread.title: Kuznetsov has 3 goals and 2 assists, Capitals top Oilers 7-4
thread.title_full: Kuznetsov has 3 goals and 2 assists, Capitals top Oilers 7-4

title: Kuznetsov has 3 goals and 2 assists, Capitals top Oilers 7-4
text:
Kuznetsov has 3 goals and 2 assists, Capitals top Oilers 7-4 The Washington Capitals beat the Edmonton Oilers 7-4 on Friday night for their fifth straight victory. Post to Facebook Kuznetsov has 3 goals and 2 assists, Capitals top Oilers 7-4 The Washington Capitals beat the Edmonton Oilers 7-4 on Friday night for their fifth straight victory.  //on.wusa9.com/1LTvr7X   Kuznetsov has 3 goals and 2 assists, Capitals top Oilers 7-4 Associated Press, AP 12:32 a.m. EDT October 24, 2015 Capitals logo CONNECT TWEET   
EDMONTON, Alberta (AP) - Evgeny Kuznetsov had three goals and two assists to help the Washington Capitals beat the Edmonton Oilers 7-4 on Friday night for their fifth straight victory. 
Kuznetsov opened the scoring on a backhander at 3:05 of the first period, gave Washington a 4-3 lead with another backhander at 6:17 of the second, and completed his first career hat trick with a snap shot on a power play with 3:01 left in the third period. 
Nicklas Backstrom, Marcus Johansson, Andre Burakovsky and Justin Williams also scored for Washington, and Philipp Grubauer made 19 saves in his first start of the season. Playing for the third time in four nights, the Capitals improved to 6-1-0. 
Rookie star Connor McDavid scored his fifth goal of the season for Edmonton. Benoit Pouliot, Rob Klinkhammer and Ryan Nugent-Hopkins also scored.
